definition: abbr. for Hunan 湖南 province in south central China/abbr. for Xiangjiang river in Hunan province
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: It is characterized by thick and pungent flavors.
sentences.chinese: 湘菜的特点在于味浓和味辛。

sentences.english: Hunan cuisine consists of local Cuisines of Xiangjiang Region, Dongting Lake and Xiangxi coteau.
sentences.chinese: 湘菜由湘江地区，洞亭湖和湘西的地方菜肴组成。

sentences.english: There is a nice Hunanese Restaurant up ahead on the Chinese Food Street.
sentences.chinese: 前面就是中华美食街，有家不错的湘菜馆。

sentences.english: Among lots of regionally flavor restaurants in Beijing, the Xiangcai restaurant also expand rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 在北京各种地方风味餐馆中，湘菜馆也可谓异军突起。

sentences.english: Between Hunan and Sichuan, which province packs more heat into its cuisine?
sentences.chinese: 哪些更辣的，湘菜或者川菜呢？

definition: Sichuan poached sliced fish in hot chili oil
duck's blood and beef tripe in spicy soup
